selected_links.title: Householder pre-application advice | Guide to planning services ...
strengths: Detailed guide to planning services and processes for the installation of solar panels.
Provides helpful information on whether planning permission is needed.
selected_links.reasoning: This resource provides a comprehensive guide to planning services related to the installation of solar panels, including whether or not planning permission is necessary, which makes it highly relevant for council customer information needs.

context.need: I'd like to install solar panels on my house and want to know if I need permission to have someone undertake this work.

recommendation.reason: Link appears suitable for user needs
next_steps: Follow the link to access the content

Reason.need: I'd like to install solar panels on my house and want to know if I need permission to have someone undertake this work.
Reason.reasoning: The content provides clear guidance on whether planning permission is required for installing solar panels, using the Planning Portal as a first point of contact. It also mentions that if one needs planning permission, they can discuss their proposal further with the development management team through a duty officer appointment or a more formal householder pre-application service.
Reason.next_actions: The resident can visit the Planning Portal (<a href='https://www.planningportal.co.uk/' title='planning portal'>) first, as suggested, to establish if planning permission is required for their solar panel installation project.

analysis.overall_assessment: The content is informative and helpful in answering the resident's questions related to obtaining permission for installing solar panels. It also offers assistance from the development management team through duty officer appointments and formal pre-application services. However, it could benefit from including information on what to do if the resident needs help understanding the process or encounters difficulties in seeking permission.
